channel.title: Voices of Europe
channel.description:
Interviews with noted Europeans on a variety of subjects, conducted by Milton Mayer, American author and broadcaster, lecturer and professor in the Institute of Social Research at Frankfurt University.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Mademoiselle Hedy and Maire Halonen
item.description: Interviews with a Mademoiselle Hedy and Maire Halonen about, respectively, existentialist living in Paris and life in Finland during World War II.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Battle casualties

item.title: Sven Lindquist
item.description: An interview with Sven Lindquist, a Swedish man who is intently focused on world affairs. The main topic is the current state of Sweden, as well as the impact that World War II had on Sweden.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: World War, 1939-1945--Sweden.

item.title: F.K. Otto Dibelius and Martin Stiencke
item.description: Interviews with F.K. Otto Dibelius and Martin Stiencke about Christianity and Buddhism in Germany.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Nazis.

item.title: Herr Ernst-Heinrich Schaefer and M. Chazelle
item.description: Interviews with Ernst-Heinrich Schaefer, a Saarlander in the steel industry, and Jacques Chazelle, a French diplomat. Current issues in Saarland are discussed.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Saarland (Germany)--History--20th century.

item.title: Elisabeth Noelle-Neumann
item.description: An interview about surveying public opinion with Dr. Elisabeth Noelle-Neumann, a German political scientist.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Surveys--Methodology.

item.title: Johan Hannak and Dr. Kurt Rothschild
item.description: Interviews with Johan Hannak and Dr. Kurt Rothschild, two Austrians, about issues in Austria in the aftermath of World War II.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Austria--History--20th century.

item.title: Olavi Aarnio and Dr. Olli Vaartaja
item.description: Interviews with Olavi Aarnio and Dr. Olli Vaartaja about issues in Finland, particularly during World War II.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Russo-Finnish War, 1939-1940.

item.title: Andre and Magda Trocme
item.description: This program features an interview with Andre and Magda Trocme, a French couple who aided Jewish refugees during World War II.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Jewish refugees--History--20th century.

item.title: The population problem
item.description: Interviews with Dr. McCormick and Dr. Karl Evang on the population problem.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Developing countries.

item.title: A. S. Neill, Paul Geheeb and Dr. Teresita Sandesky Scelba
item.description: Interviews with A. S. Neill, Paul Geheeb and Dr. Teresita Sandesky Scelba about education in Europe.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Educators--Europe.

item.title: Horstmar Stauber and Walter Wolman
item.description: This program features interviews with two German students about fraternities, societies, and student life.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Students--Germany--History--20th century.

item.title: The Duke of Bedford and Lord Adams
item.description: Interviews with The Duke of Bedford and Lord Adams.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Politicians--Great Britain--Interviews.

item.title: W. Grigor McClelland
item.description: An interview with W. Grigor McClelland, a British businessman who toured Communist China and the Soviet Union to assess life and business under communism for himself.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Soviet Union--Description and travel.

item.title: Gertrud Muller
item.description: An interview with Gertrud Muller, a young German woman from a small town, about a U.S. $50 bill that she had come into possession of, which was then against the law in Germany. Some of her opinions reflect the antisemitism that persisted in Germany after World War II.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Money--Germany

item.title: Ade_le Heilborn and Agda Rossel
item.description: Interviews with Ade_le Heilborn and Agda Rossel. Topics covered relate to Sweden.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Labor--Sweden.

item.title: Emil Frederiksen and Knud Klem
item.description: Interviews with Emil Frederickson and Knud Klem that discuss elements of Danish culture.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Denmark--Drama.

item.title: Percy Diggle and Joseph Keiling.
item.description: Interviews with Percy Diggle and Joe Keiling about issues related to England.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Labor

item.title: Nona Suminah Kamil and Dr. P. J. Koets
item.description: Interviews with Nona Suminah Kamil and Dr. P. J. Koets about Indonesia and its then-recent independence.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Netherlands--Colonies--Indonesia--History.

item.title: Mario Tosoni, Silvio Leonardi, and Adriano Olivetti
item.description: In this program, Milton Mayer speaks to three Italians: a schoolteacher, and two businessman.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Fascism--Italy--20th century.

item.title: John Strachey and Paolo Vittorelli
item.description: Interviews with the British Labour politician John Strachey and the Italian socialist politician, Paolo Vittorelli.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Socialism--Italy--History--20th century.

item.title: Sir Herbert Broadley and Dr. P. F. Noach
item.description: Interviews with Sir Herbert Broadley and Dr. P. F. Noach. Topics covered include United Nations efforts to combat hunger and poverty.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Hunger.

item.title: Professor Carl Friedrich von Weizs�_cker and Pastor Wilhelm Meusching
item.description: Interviews with physicist Professor Carl Friedrich von Weizs�_cker and Pastor Wilhelm Meusching.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Christians--Germany.

item.title: Andre Maurois and Gunnar Myrdal
item.description: This program features interviews with French author Andre Maurois and with Swedish sociologist and economist Gunnar Myrdal.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Race relations--United States--History--20th century.

item.title: Headley Whitehead
item.description: Milton Mayer interviews Headley Whitehead, British warden of a residential youth center in Manchester. They discuss the co-operative movement in Britain.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Consumer cooperatives--Great Britain--History.

item.title: Dr. John Rawlings Rees and Dr. Hans Hoff
item.description: Interviews with Dr. John Rawlings Rees and Dr. Hans Hoff about psychology and the mental well-being of Europeans in the mid-20th century.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Psychoanalysis.

item.title: Dr. Alf Ahlberg and Gertrud Magaziner
item.description: Interviews with Dr. Alf Ahlberg and Gertrud Magaziner about education in Sweden and Austria.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Adult education--Austria.

item.title: Reverend Michael Scott
item.description: An interview with Reverend Michael Scott, focused on issues in South Africa.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Afrikaners

item.title: Bertrand Russell
item.description: This program features interviews with Bertrand Russell
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Reality.

item.title: Max Habicht
item.description: An interview with Max Habicht.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Europe

item.title: Renato Mieli
item.description: An interview with Renato Mieli, an Italian communist leader.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Communism--Italy--Rome--History--20th century.

item.title: Countess Maria Goedela von Bismarck-Sch̦nhausen
item.description: An interview with Countess Maria Goedela von Bismarck-Sch̦nhausen about the changes in Germany from the 19th century to the midpoint of the 20th century. Main topics include her grandfather, Otto von Bismarck, and her husband, Hermann Graf Keyserling.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Bismarck, Otto, Fu_rst von, 1815-1898

item.title: Five European students
item.description: This program presents an interview with five European students about culture and world politics in the early 1950s.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: World politics--1945-1955--Public opinion.

item.title: Dr. Schmidt and Hilda Pabst
item.description: Interviews with "Dr. Schmidt" about German prisoners of war and Hilda Pabst about young people's attitudes on Germany and remilitarization.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Remilitarization--Germany--History--20th century.

item.title: Hannelore Altmeier and Fritz Schneider
item.description: Interviews with Hannelore Altmeier and Fritz Schneider, two young Germans. The primary topic is life in East Germany and how it relates to West Germany.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Teachers--Germany

item.title: Yvonne Brunoy and Maria Comberti
item.description: Interviews with Yvonne Brunoy, a Parisian prostitute and Maria Comberti, an Italian villa owner.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Prostitutes--France--Social conditions.

item.title: Lord Beveridge
item.description: An interview with Lord Beveridge about his highly influential "Beveridge Report."
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Welfare state--Great Britain.

item.title: Dr. Mogens Fog and Gerald Bailey
item.description: Interviews with Dr. Mogens Fog, a Danish communist leader, and Gerald Bailey, a British Quaker activist.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Pacifists

item.title: Elsa Adami and Nina Oulasevitch
item.description: Interviews with Elsa Adami and Nina Oulasevitch about traveling through Europe and lodging for travelers.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Hitchhiking--Europe.

item.title: Hans Neumann and Frau Wagner
item.description: Interviews with Hans Neumann and "Frau Wagner" about life in West Berlin and East Berlin in the years after World War Two.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Berlin (Germany : West)

item.title: Judaism after World War II
item.description: This program features an interview with a rabbi about Judaism in Germany in the aftermath of World War II.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Judaism--Germany.

item.title: Hermann Trittlewitz and Dr. Edith Pulewka
item.description: Interviews with Hermann Trittlewitz and Dr. Edith Pulewka, with a focus on the Saarland region in Germany.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Political parties--Germany.

item.title: Martin Niemo_ller and Karl Barth
item.description: This program features interviews with the German pastor and theologian Martin Niemo_ller and the Swiss theologian Karl Barth.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Theology--History--20th century.

item.title: Paolo Sylos Labini and Veniero Marsan
item.description: Interviews with Paolo Sylos Labini and Veniero Marsan about economic conditions in Italy.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Italy--Commerce.

item.title: An Austrian on the United States
item.description: In this program, an Austrian woman reflects on her time spent living in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: United States--Description and travel.

item.title: The Carmen story
item.description: An interview with Carmen Ruiz de Garibay, a Spanish noblewoman living in France.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Socialism.

item.title: Abstract art
item.description: This program features a joint interview with abstract painters Edgard Pillet and Rella Rudolph on abstract art.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Painters.

item.title: Odd Nansen and Waltraud Skupin
item.description: Interviews with Odd Nansen and Waltraud Skupin. Topics include Germany, Silesia, and humanitarianism.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Humanitarianism.

item.title: Salvador de Madariaga and William Allen Jowitt
item.description: This program features interviews with the Spanish writer Salvador de Madariaga and with British politician and lawyer William Allen Jowitt.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: National security.

item.title: Meteorology and the Swiss film industry
item.description: This program consists of two separate interviews. In the first interview, Milton Mayer interviews an Austrian doctor and professor of meteorology. In the second interview, Mayer speaks to Lazar Wechsler, a Swiss film producer.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Motion pictures--Switzerland--Plots, themes, etc.

item.title: Helmut Weber
item.description: An interview with Helmut Weber, a Neo-Nazi leader in Germany.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Germany--History--20th century.

item.title: G.D.H. Cole
item.description: This program presents an interview with G.D.H. Cole about socialism in Great Britain.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Socialism--Great Britain--20th century.

item.title: Claude Bourdet
item.description: This program presents an interview with Claude Bourdet, a French writer and journalist who was active in the French Resistance during World War II.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Political activists--France.

item.title: Professor Carl Hermann and Eva Hermann
item.description: An interview with Professor Carl Hermann and Eva Hermann about life in Germany under the Nazis.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Jews--Germany.

item.title: Pastor Martin Niemo_ller
item.description: An interview with Pastor Martin Niemo_ller, a German clergyman who was imprisoned by the Nazis during World War II.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Spiritual life

item.title: Saarland
item.description: An interview with an anonymous Saarlander, referred to as "Herr Busch," about recent developments with Saarland and its independence.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Saarland (Germany)--History--20th century.

item.title: "Prof. Schmidt" and "Frau Margarete Lehman"
item.description: Interviews with the pseudonymous "Professor Schmidt" and Margarete Lehman, two Germans each from a different side of the divide in Germany.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Communism--Germany

item.title: Dr. Renate Unkrodt
item.description: An interview with Dr. Renate Unkrodt, a German journalist.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: German newspapers.

item.title: Oswald Mosley
item.description: This program features an interview with British fascist leader, Oswald Mosley.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Fascism--Great Britain--History--20th century.

item.title: Klause Kammler and Huguette Kailat
item.description: This program features interviews with two European students, one from Germany and another from France.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Germany--History--1945-1990.

item.title: Lauri Posti and Irmeli Viherjuuri
item.description: Milton Mayer interviews Professor Lauri Posti and Irmeli Viherjuuri. Topics discussed include the Finnish language and the Finnish tradition of saunas.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Sauna--Finland.

item.title: Paul and Ingeborg Fent
item.description: An interview with Paul Fent, a Viennese playwright, and Ingeborg Fent, a fairy tale writer. The Fents talk about Austria, its history and culture.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Austria--History.

item.title: Walter Gaupp
item.description: This program features an interview with Walter Gaupp, a German headmaster of a school that was part of the Experiment in International Living.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: School principals--Germany

item.title: Erich Hoffmann
item.description: This program features interviews with Erich Hoffmann and Hans-Peter Muller about student exchange programs and work camps.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Work camps

item.title: Baron Von Munchausen
item.description: This program features an interview with the grandson of Baron Von Munchausen.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Communists.

item.title: Dr. Gerrit Jan van Heuven Goedhart
item.description: An interview Dr. Gerrit Jan van Heuven Goedhart, a Dutch politician and diplomat.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: United Nations--Officials and employees.

item.title: Elisabeth Mann-Borgese and Kurt Rieder
item.description: This program features interviews with Elisabeth Mann-Borgese and Kurt Rieder about, respectively, education in Europe and conditions in South Tyrol.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Trentino-Alto Adige (Italy)--Ethnic relations.

item.title: Friedrich Luft and Wolfgang Staudte
item.description: Interviews with Friedrich Luft and Wolfgang Staudte. Both interviews discuss the states of theater and film in Germany in the years after World War Two.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Theater--Germany.

item.title: Willy Kressman and Senator Bach
item.description: Interviews with Willy Kressman and Otto Bach, two German politicians.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Labor and laboring classes--Germany

item.title: Veli Merikoski and Dr. Arvo Puukari
item.description: Interviews with Professor Veli Merikoski and Dr. Arvo Puukari about Finland during World War II and its aftermath.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: World War, 1939-1945--Finland.

item.title: Dr. Herbert Tingsten and Claude Petit
item.description: Interviews with Dr. Herbert Tingsten and Claude Petit about, respectively, life in Sweden and France.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: France--History--20th century.

item.title: Dr. Carlo Levi and Dr. Riccardo Bauer
item.description: Interviews with Dr. Carlo Levi and Dr. Riccardo Bauer. Levi talks about Rome and Bauer talks about life in prison under the Italian fascists.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Italy--Civilization--20th century.

item.title: Gottlieb Duttweiler and Enriques Agnoletti
item.description: This program features interviews with Gottlieb Duttweiler, a Swiss businessman, and Enriques Agnoletti, a politician and member of the Italian Resistance.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Italy--Economic conditions--1945-1976.

item.title: Black market
item.description: This program addresses "what makes the black market black" and looks at the thriving black market in Europe.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Money--Europe.

item.title: Hallam Tennyson and voices on the street.
item.description: This program features an interview with Hallam Tennyson, the great-grandson of Alfred Lord Tennyson. The second part of the program features interviews with various people in Hyde Park about the state of England at the time.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Great Britain--Civilization--20th century.

item.title: Erik von Kuehnelt-Leddihn
item.description: This program features an interview with Erik von Kuehnelt-Leddihn, an Austrian nobleman and socio-political theorist.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Political thinkers

item.title: Josef L. Hromadka
item.description: An interview with Professor Josef L. Hromadka about conditions in Czechoslovakia.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Czechoslovakia--Social conditions--1945-1992.

item.title: Lucy Gable and Ines Zilli-Guy
item.description: Interviews with Lucy Gable and Ines Zilli-Guy about life for women in Europe.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Women--Europe--Social conditions.

item.title: Prince Valerio Borghese
item.description: An interview with Prince Valerio Borghese, an Italian fascist leader.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Movimento sociale italiano.

item.title: Kaspar Mayr and Major Jan Linzel
item.description: Interviews with Kaspar Mayr and Jan Linzel about pacifism.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Pacifists

item.title: Dr. Johannes Novrup and Peter Manniche
item.description: Interviews with Dr. Johannes Novrup and Peter Manniche about education in Denmark.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Internationalism.

item.title: Robert Silvey and Robert Fabian
item.description: Interviews with Robert Silvey of the British Broadcasting Corporation and Superintendent Robert Fabian, a former detective at Scotland Yard.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Crime and criminals--Great Britain.

item.title: Don Manetti and Giovanni Pioli
item.description: Interviews with Don Manetti and Professor Giovanni Pioli about Catholicism and fascism in Italy.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Fascism--Italy.

item.title: Ailo Maegaard and Sven Fisker
item.description: Interviews with Ailo Maegaard and Sven Fisker about the importance of shipping and agriculture to the Danish economy.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Farmers--Denmark.

item.title: Dr. Willem Visser t'Hooft
item.description: An interview with Dr. Willem Visser t'Hooft about his work with the World Council of Churches.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Spiritual life

item.title: Lionel Durand and Claude Terrail
item.description: Interviews with Lionel Durand and Claude Terrail. The interviews focus on issues in France and, particularly, Paris.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: French

item.title: Carl Friedrich von Weizs�_cker
item.description: This program features an interview with the German physicist and philosopher Carl Friedrich von Weizs�_cker.
item.dc:creator: Mayer, Milton, 1908-1986
item.dc:subject: Philosophers--Germany--Interviews.
